sub_topic: Topological quantum field theory and its applications.
message_1: What is the Euler characteristic of a closed orientable surface of genus 2 (i.e., a two-holed torus) in the context of topological quantum field theory?
message_2:
The Euler characteristic (χ) of a closed orientable surface can be calculated using the formula:

χ = 2 - 2g

where g is the genus of the surface (i.e., the number of holes). In the case of a two-holed torus (genus 2), the Euler characteristic is:

χ = 2 - 2(2) = 2 - 4 = -2

So, the Euler characteristic of a closed orientable surface of genus 2 in the context of topological quantum field theory is -2.
